data.title: Container nodes don't refresh when contents change
data.body:
The hassles of scene refresh.

When manipulating scene components they don't refresh automatically in the editor. Only when running the app , changing the container of the elements you modify or switching to another scene and back the editor refreshes the scene components.

Example 1  

I move a button in the scene. Note that it should be automatically ordered and centered based on the CenterContainer VBox Container but scene does not refresh automatically.  

![screen shot 2016-01-13 at 6 22 23 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6987027/12292897/18713398-b9be-11e5-8f21-030095b43343.png)

Instead I have to make the container bigger than back to small to refresh.
![screen shot 2016-01-13 at 6 21 17 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6987027/12292900/197f2bbe-b9be-11e5-9b34-498a8d66de6e.png)

Example 2
Switching to another scene and back to the scene you are working on refreshes the scene.

![screen shot 2016-01-13 at 6 26 07 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6987027/12293012/b5039cc8-b9be-11e5-8d08-68c78a6c4e98.png)

![screen shot 2016-01-13 at 6 26 17 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6987027/12293018/b8e57000-b9be-11e5-8a0c-4a9ac9e4f8a0.png)

![screen shot 2016-01-13 at 6 26 19 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6987027/12293020/bce63a0e-b9be-11e5-87b5-67740e46e6df.png)

I simply ask for a button or shortcut that refreshes the scene manually AND/OR every time you save a scene it's automatically refreshed.

data.title: option to customize Godot Engine UI skin color / warmth / saturation / hue
data.body: There are options to change colors for many features in the engine from text editor to bg clear color but nothing for the UI skin itself.

data.title: JSON Improperly Escaped -- Can't Read What it Wrote
data.body:
Question marks ('?') in string values of dicts do not get escaped properly. Or rather, they get escaped when internet validators say they shouldn't be.

Converting a dict with a string with a question mark into a JSON string then trying to convert it back again will fail with a return value of 42. Here's code which demonstrates this:

```
var json_dict = {}
json_dict["Key"] = "Will it parse?"
var json_string = json_dict.to_json()
json_dict.clear()
# Parsing the string we just created will fail.
var return_code = json_dict.parse_json(json_string)
print("Parsing returns error code ", return_code)
```

data.title: An option to remember project specific ui settings like opened scenes, resource browser last folder/settings etc
data.body:
I make a project. Work on a scene. I quit and restart Godot no scene is opened. It does not remember the last opened scene(s) and I have to manually open every single scene I was working on every time I open Godot.. 

I browse a certain folder in my resource browser and set the view to list small icons. Every time I restart the browser the resource browser current folder is reset to root and the view settings back to default. It does not remember last settings and folder opened.

Any scripts or resources I had open before closing Godot are not automatically reopened. I have to do it manually every time.

data.title: full screen behaves oddly on OSX El Capitan/Yosemite (and likely Mavericks too)
data.body:
Yosemite (actually Mavericks ) introduced that custom full screen feature that any app can use. This seems to affect Godot applications in a bad way. 

So there are a few issues to report here.
1. Godot app viewport option (as opposite to 2d) seems to have no effect on Yosemite and resolution is never changed. In fact any choice combo simply makes the app goes in Yosemite full screen.
2. Godot app does not go full screen on Yosemite if fullscreen is selected and on but resizable is not selected. In fact it prevents the app from ever being able to go full screen and the Yosemite fullscreen is greyed out and cannot be used.  
3. Mouse near edge of the screen seems to trigger menu and dock (if hidden) right on top of the running app. This makes any game using say top and bottom window edge to scroll map (like for ex TBS) no longer possible. This is a big issue for me right now as I want the window to capture the mouse and the window to stay focused on the game . I don't wanna see any OS menus appearing on top of my game.
   ![screen shot 2016-01-12 at 6 20 25 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6987027/12280050/3865c2d2-b959-11e5-9c5e-080ffc0cf0e6.png)
   ![screen shot 2016-01-12 at 6 20 21 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6987027/12280143/c43c163a-b959-11e5-9de3-95ecc0482c8d.png)

When OSX saves screenshots it removes the mouse pointer. In the images above my mouse is at max bot position and max top position.

If anyone has suggestions or work arounds for these issues I am all ears. Also, I have a mac running latest and greatest patches (OSX and Godot) so I can test anything you want me to.

data.title: Fix typo
Invisible Contents of FileDialog
data.body:
There seem to be multiple conditions which cause a FileDialog to have invisible contents in 1.1 Stable. The behavior may be less deterministic in 2.0 Alpha.

In my experience (and in the attached example), all FileDialogs left with the default settings will not show the contents of the resources directory, although if you double-click where files and folders ought to be it will navigate through them.

The default access mode appears to be ACCESS_RESOURCES. Manually setting this will have no effect; the contents will still be invisible. For example:

```
extends FileDialog
func _ready():
    set_access(ACCESS_RESOURCES)
```

will not be usable. Setting the access mode to any other access mode behaves as expected. Furthermore, setting the access mode to something else and then back to ACCESS_RESOURCES before the FileDialog is even drawn appears to help in some cases:

```
extends FileDialog
func _ready():
    set_access(ACCESS_RESOURCES)
    set_access(ACCESS_USERDATA)
    set_access(ACCESS_RESOURCES)
```

The above will behave as expected in the example project, where the contents of the resources directory are visible.

But that workaround does not work in the actual project for which I'm trying to add a FileDialog. I have yet to figure out how to access the resources directory without the FileDialog's display of the resources directory's contents being invisible.

[FileExample.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/87998/FileExample.zip)

data.title: Color Ramp Editor Plugin Fix
data.body: The Color Ramp Editor originally only assigned itself to the canvas editor thereby only making it appear when editing canvas item-derived nodes and not spatial-derived. I've modified it now to work on both, similar to the shader editor.

data.title: Collada files import into Godot with missing geometry
data.body:
An FBX file with animation (converted to Collada format using Autodesk FBX converter) imports into Godot with part of the geometry missing.
The FBX converter used:
![colladageometry-04](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/12267286/ac57b7f2-b947-11e5-94a4-6bf7c6725723.png)
The resulting Collada filed opened in 3DS Max 2016:
![colladageometry-01](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/12267708/b9181be2-b949-11e5-8778-0306773212bb.png)
Imported into 3DS Max using these settings:
![colladageometry-05](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/12267326/e2677ee0-b947-11e5-8ac9-63d684341fa6.png)
The Collada file as it appears in Godot after importing:
![colladageometry-02](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/12267347/f5a3f092-b947-11e5-84f7-de8815c7d577.png)
Using these import settings:
![colladageometry-03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/15687516/12267354/0060fab6-b948-11e5-9447-de921ff91367.png)
As the red outline indicates the characters arrow is missing in Godot but not in 3DS Max.

data.title: warn the user when the custom sort function isn't consistent
data.body:
not always, but very often crashed on Windows 7.

``` gdscript
extends Node2D

func _ready():
    randomize()

    for i in range(20):
        var list = range(10)
        list.sort_custom(self, "shuffle_array")
        print(list)

func shuffle_array(a, b):
    return randi() % 2 == 0
```

I ran this code 20 times on Windows 7.
8 times good, and 12 times crashed.

1 of 30 crashed on Ubuntu 14.04.

and one more weird thing is sometimes element is missing.

``` gdscript
    for i in range(10): # changed 20 to 10
        var list = range(10)
        list.sort_custom(self, "shuffle_array")
        print(list)
```

this is on Windows 7.

```
9, 8, 4, 3, 2, 1, 6, 5, 7, 0
9, 8, 6, 5, , 0, 3, 1, 4, 7    > "2" is gone
8, 7, 4, 3, 6, 2, 0, 9, 1, 5
9, 5, 4, 3, 2, , 6, 8, 7, 0    > "1" is gone
9, 8, 7, 6, 2, 1, 0, 3, 4, 5
9, 8, 7, 6, 5, 0, 3, 1, 2, 4
4, , 2, 0, 8, 6, 9, 5, 7, 3    > "1" is gone
9, 8, 7, 5, 2, 0, 1, 3, 6, 4
7, 6, 1, 0, 4, 2, 8, 9, 5, 3
9, 7, 6, 4, 3, 2, 1, 0, 8, 5
```

this is on Ubuntu 14.04

```
8, 3, 2, 1, 0, 5, 7, 4, 6, 9
8, 6, 5, [], 1, 0, 2, 4, 7, 9
8, 6, 5, [], [], 0, 3, 4, 7, 9
9, 8, 7, 6, 4, 3, 2, 1, 0, 5
9, 8, 6, 5, 4, 2, 7, 0, 1, 3
8, 6, 5, 9, 4, 3, 7, [], 0, 2
5, 3, 2, 1, 0, 6, 4, 8, 7, 9
9, 6, 4, 2, 3, 7, [], 0, 5, 8
7, 6, 5, 4, 9, 2, 1, 0, 3, 8
7, 3, 2, 1, 6, 0, 4, 5, 8, 9
```

data.title: Directory.open crashes on android 6.0.1
data.body:
**GDScript**

``` gdscript
extends Node2D

func _ready():
    list_files_in_directory("res://")
    pass


func list_files_in_directory(path):
    var files = []
    var dir = Directory.new()
    dir.open(path)  # crashes at here
    dir.list_dir_begin()

    while true:
        var file = dir.get_next()
        if file == "":
            break
        elif not file.begins_with("."):
            files.append(file)

    dir.list_dir_end()

    return files
```

I don't know why, but it works on android 4.4.

data.title: SampleLibrary editor window needs stop functionality(button)
data.body:
In the SampleLibrary editor window, we need a stop button. Currently when a sample file which is set to loop is played, there is no easy way to make it stop. The only way to stop it is closing the window and reopen it again. It needs to be reopened since closing the window has no effect.
![samplelibrary_editor_missing_stop_function](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9153651/12229265/e6d5405c-b86b-11e5-8fac-9dec38bf99dc.jpg)

data.title: CollisionShape2D duplicate will change with parent.
data.body:
I created a CollisionShape2D and set it to SegmentShape2D.
When I duplicate that CollisionShape and change it by the inner handles, the first created changes too.
This happens with other shape-types too, that have inner handles (capsule, circle, ray...).
I'll attach a picture with mouse-cursor pointing at what I call "inner handle".

![segmentshape2d](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16130334/12228275/2cb41f04-b839-11e5-8791-4d1d0e22e564.png)

data.title: Replace export pack mode "Copy" with "Exec+Zip"
data.body:
Comment on this from #godotengine-devel:

```
16:04:38 <eska> what's "Pack mode: Copy" supposed to do? sounds like it's supposed to just recreate the file structure (instead of a pck), but it doesn't seem to work
16:11:06 <eska> reduzio, punto, seems like it's that way since 1.1, so probably no one knows other than you? ^
16:16:44 <reduzio> eska, that needs to be removed, it's pretty dangerous :|
16:17:14 <reduzio> godot support exporting all the files to a folder instead of packing them and use them unpacked
16:17:42 <reduzio> but updating a directory tree is kinda dangerous, so it's either changed to work exporting a zip with all stuff, or removed
```

This change removes pack mode "Copy" and adds "Exec+Zip". I also renamed the options to hopefully be more expressive.
Additionally, `bundle` is now a separate toggle.

Related: #2788, #2879

data.title: Make SpriteRegionEditor remember state when switching scenes (fixes #3245)
data.body:
This makes remember the values when switching scenes, but doesn't restore values when clossing and opening again the editor.
However, CanvasItemEditor state doesn't restore the value neighter, i think this is another issue.

data.title: Remember Transform menu settings for the Spatial Editor
data.body: BTW, I followed the existing code and checked if `d.has("option")` before retrieving the option. But what's the point on doing so if there are ERR_FAIL_COND calls at the top that already do that?

data.title: AudioStreamGibberish gone?
data.body:
When I picked up Godot I saw a "gibberish" function which I wanted to make use of in my game, but after mentioning it on IRC, it seems it's been disabled. Is it scheduled for removal, or will it come back eventually?

I can live without it, but it'd be really convenient to have around.
